name: Tune Hotel Kings Cross

reviews.text: My room (330) was small but new, immaculate, quiet, with perfect sheets and thick curtains, perfect for a short stay. The hotel is on a busy street but the back is very quiet and the staff very nice. Make sure to order the towel pack!
reviews.title: Very good little hotel

reviews.text: Good location. The hotel is quiet and clean. We found the bed very comfortable for a good sleep and we appreciated the good service and quality. The staff was very kind and helpful at all time. This is a really cheap hotel for London. We had a nice stay.
reviews.title: A nice stay in a confortable hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is clean, nice interior design. But the rooms are very very small. Its okey for a short while if you want a hotel close to everything like the subway or train station but for a long visit i would get crazy. There is nowhere to sit exept the bed, nowhere to put the bag.
reviews.title: Okey hotel near central hotel.

reviews.text: But its clean, affordable and the location is great so i still recommend it for a short stay.
reviews.title: very good budget hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked a double room at this hotel for 3 nights, the room was so small that I thought I had been booked into a single by mistake but after speaking to duty manager who showed me other rooms on 1st floor realised it was supposed to be a double. I then found the room had not been cleaned as there was fluff, hairs and a womans hair band on the floor just under the bed. The manager was very apologetic and cleaned the floor whilst we waited in reception, offered free coffee, free housekeeping which I did not take as all had wanted was a clean room.
reviews.title: Very Small Rooms

reviews.text: I have checked the hotels photos of the rooms and the room I was in does not look anywhere as big, all in all ok if you only want to spend 1 night and on a budget.
reviews.title: Clean & basic - get what you pay for

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is handy for Kings Cross and St. Pancras Stations, and a short walk to Bloomsbury where there a a good selection of pubs and restaurants, especially in the Brunswick Centre.
reviews.title: Great value base for exploring London

reviews.text: The best part of this hotel is its location to the main train station, a 5 minute walk and you're there.
reviews.title: Clean, compact and comfy

reviews.text: Other than its location, the hotel is very basic. Rooms are small with the bed taking up much of the space, but is sufficent for short stays. We chose a room without windows (which meant we would have to actually step outside the hotel to see what the weather was like!).
reviews.title: ssw

reviews.text: i found this hotel to be just what i needed. It was cheap for london & basic but all i wanted was a clean quiet place with comfy bed & shower. It was basic with no windows but cant complain for the price & i still slept good. If budget & location is what you are after then you will not go wrong with this hotel
reviews.title: clean & tidy in good location

reviews.text: I stayed at a Tune Hotel in Liverpool Street over the Jubilee weekend, and took advantage of their £9 introductory offer combined with a mailing list flash sale for a working holiday/house-hunting starting on the August bank holiday weekend. I stayed for 5 nights in total - the first in a double room without a window and in a twin room with a window for the remainder (I thought 5 nights without a window might be a bit too much!) It's very convenient for Kings Cross/St Pancras, the Brunswick Centre near Russell Square and, I guess, even Euston.
reviews.title: Another great stay at the Tune chain

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Much like its sister establishment, the rooms are bright, modern and acceptably clean, if a little on the small side - but if you're only going to be sleeping in them then that's not an issue. I usually work nights during the week from a home office, and the wi-fi here was reliable enough on the whole to be a great temporary base for two 8-hour night/early morning shifts, with only a temporary loss/slowdown of connection on one night.
reviews.title: another great experience at a Tune hotel

reviews.text: Staff were very warm, attentive and personable, as at the Liverpool Street property, and extremely quick to fix issues with water dripping out of my air-con and very minor problems with my safe and TV remote. They recommended great takeaways for a night worker, were happy to brew up and supply several cans of energy drink, and always seemed to be able to provide answer to persistent questions from a long-stay guest.
reviews.title: Good and basic

reviews.text: The only gripes were that the lifts are a little on the small side, and that traffic noise from the busy road junction between Gray's Inn Road and Swinton Street was sometimes troublesome, but these were only minor inconveniences in the grand scheme of things. Although I am about to move to London, I would stay in one of their properties again without hesitation - particularly if they opened elsewhere in the UK.
reviews.title: Newly refurbished hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At last an alternative to the often overpriced, outdated, dull hotels rooms in London. At Tune Hotels the room price is "customisable": you only pay for what you need, the room rate depends on the demand and how early it is booked. We paid a fair price for a double room on a Saturday night on the last week end of the Paralympic Games, no window, no tv, no internet. Check in and check out formalities went very quickly and smoothly, staff very welcoming and professional. The whole building has been recently completely renovated and it is spotless clean everywhere. Rooms are fully air conditioned with very good finishing touches and attention for details, bathrooms are fitted with Villeroy&Boch sinks and Grohe taps and we found the bed extremely comfortable! There is no restaurant or breakfast room but at reception an excellent espresso is available, many food choices are available in the area within very short walking distance.
reviews.title: Excellent value for money

reviews.text: Having visited the Tune Hotel at Westminster on a few occasions we decided to give the new King's Cross Hotel a try. Situated just a 5-10 minute walk from King's Cross station, the hotel is on a busy road and is close to several pubs, restaurants and convenience stores.
reviews.title: Great for a short stay.

reviews.text: Inside the hotel lobby is spacious and the service efficient. Rooms are simple but clean with a very comfortable bed. There are no extras thrown in but towels, television and Internet are all very reasonably priced. There is also good, cheap coffee available from reception.
reviews.title: Very clean and comfortable

reviews.text: Much better than Easyhotels which have much less desirable rooms, Tune is great value for money.
reviews.title: Marvellous for the money

reviews.text: Check in went very smoothly and quickly. The elevators are quite small and can really only
reviews.title: Clean, fresh, & kind staff

aka: Tune Hotel Kings Cross London, England
description: Whether you’ve missed the last train home, heading on a business trip to Europe or spending a night in the capital for business or pleasure, Tune Hotel King’s Cross is the ideal base. The hotel opened its doors in July 2012 and has been providing couples and friends with a cost-efficient place to stay ever since. Located just 400 meters from King’s Cross and St Pancras International Station (Eurostar terminal), the hotel is also within walking distance of the British Library and British Museum. Looking to explore Covent Garden or Leicester Square, the property is just three and four London Underground stops respectively. “Experience Tune Hotels, your 5-star bed at a one-star price”All hotels feature space‐efficient, streamlined rooms focusing on high‐quality basics. Rooms vary in size from 8 sq metres and are equipped with a double or two single Hypnos beds (the type you’ll find in five-star hotels). Every room has an en-suite with a power shower, air conditioning and heating with individual control. The £10.00 add-on package is included in the online booking price which includes the television, wireless internet access, a towel, toiletries and use of the in-room safe. Early check-in and late check-out are available for £15.00 and luggage storage costs £2.50 per bag / per day.Daily housekeeping is also available at £8.00, through for long stays guests, rooms are cleaned on day four of your stay and every three days thereafter (included in the rate).
